tit.e: Uiro (a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder)
Uiro (a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder)
Uiro (a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder)

sen.j: ういろう（外郎）は蒸し菓子の一つ。
sen.e: The term "Uiro" refers to a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder.
The term "Uiro" refers to a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder.
The term Uiro refers to a sort of sweetened steamed cake made of rice powder.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がないので" "を削除

sen.j: ういろ、外郎餅（ういろうもち）とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called Uiro or Uiro-mochi.
It is also called Uiro or Uiro-mochi.
It is also called Uiro or Uiro-mochi.

sen.j: 名古屋市、小田原市、山口市、伊勢市、岐阜県、京都市、徳島県、中津市、神戸市長田区、宮崎市などの名物となっている。
sen.e: It is a famous product in Nagoya City, Odawara City, Yamaguchi City, Ise City, Gifu Prefecture, Kyoto City, Tokushima Prefecture, Nakatsu City, Nagata Ward of Kobe City, Miyazaki City, and so on.
It is a famous product in Nagoya City, Odawara City, Yamaguchi City, Ise City, Gifu Prefecture, Kyoto City, Tokushima Prefecture, Nakatsu City, Nagata Ward of Kobe City, Miyazaki City, and so on.
It is a famous product in Nagoya City, Odawara City, Yamaguchi City, Ise City, Gifu Prefecture, Kyoto City, Tokushima Prefecture, Nakatsu City, Nagata Ward of Kobe City, Miyazaki City and elsewhere.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 米やワラビ、小麦粉などの粉に砂糖を加え蒸して作るが、主原料の粉は各地により異なる。
sen.e: It is made by adding sugar to the powders such as rice, bracken and flour and steaming it, and the kind of powder is different among various places.
It is made by adding sugar to the powders such as rice, bracken and flour and steaming it, and the kind of powder is differs among various places.
It is made by adding sugar to the powders such as rice, warabi and flour and steaming it, and the kind of powder varies among regions.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 小豆、抹茶などが加えられることもある。
sen.e: The other ingredients such as an adzuki bean and green powdered tea are added in some cases.
The other ingredients such as an adzuki bean and green powdered tea are added in some cases.
Other ingredients such as an azuki beans and powdered tea are added in some cases.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 詳しくは、各地のういろうを参照。
sen.e: For detail, see the section of the Uiro in various places.
For details, see the section of the Uiro in various places.
For details, refer to the sections on The Uiro in various places.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースをのぞき、参照先の訳語に合わせました。

sen.j: ういろうは、神奈川県小田原市が発祥の地であり、同名の民間薬（ういろう (薬品)）を製造する外郎家（小田原）の来客用菓子として伝えられていたものが、苗字の外郎がそのまま菓子名の「ういろう」となり、明治以降に薬と共に販売されるようになったことで全国に広まったと考えられている。
sen.e: The Uiro originates from the Odawara City in the Kanagawa Prefecture, and it is thought that the sweet for guests of the Uiro family (Odawara) which produced a folk medicine named Uiro had begun to be sold as a sweet named 'Uiro' of the family name with the medicine after the Meiki Period, and had been spread all over the country.

The Uiro originates from the Odawara City in the Kanagawa Prefecture, and it is thought that the sweet for guests of the Uiro family (Odawara) which produced a folk medicine named Uiro had begun to be sold as a sweet named 'Uiro' of the family name with the medicine after the Meiki Period, and had been spread all over the country.

The sweet called Uiro originates from Odawara City, Kanagawa Prefecture, and it is thought that the sweet for guests of the Uiro family (Odawara), which produced a folk medicine named Uiro, was sold under the name Uiro after the Meiji period all over the country.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。表記を変えました。

sen.j: ういろうは1931年に名古屋駅でホームでういろうの立ち売りを始め、1964年に東海道新幹線が開通後はういろうだけが新幹線での車内販売が許されたことからういろうは有名になったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the Uiro was begun to be sold at a stand on the platform of the Nagoya station in 1931 and that it became famous because only Uiro was permitted to be sold in the train after the opening of New Tokaido Line in 1964.

It is said that the Uiro was first sold at a stand on the platform of Nagoya station in 1931 and that it became famous because only Uiro was permitted to be sold in the train after the opening of New Tokaido Line in 1964.

It is said that the Uiro was first sold at a stand on the platform of Nagoya station in 1931 and that it became famous because only Uiro was permitted to be sold in the train after the opening of New Tokaido Line in 1964.

sen.j: なお、「ういろう」や「外郎」は普通名詞であり、商標として独占的に使用することは認められていない。
sen.e: In addition, the word 'Uiro (ういろう or外郎)' is a common noun and is not permitted to be used exclusively as a brand name.
In addition, the word 'Uiro (ういろう or外郎)' is a common noun and is not permitted to be used exclusively as a brand name.
In addition, the word 'Uiro (ういろう or 外郎)' is a common noun and is not permitted to be used exclusively as a brand name.

tit.e: The Uiro in the Nagoya City

sen.j: 名古屋市のういろうは米を主とする粉に砂糖を加え、蒸して作る。
sen.e: The Uiro in the Nagoya City is made by adding sugar to the powder mainly made of rice and steaming it.
The Uiro in Nagoya City is made by adding sugar to the powder mainly made of rice and steaming it.
The Uiro in Nagoya City is made by adding sugar to the flour mainly made of rice; and steaming this.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 黒砂糖で味を付けるのが基本であるが、白砂糖が用いられることもある。
sen.e: Basically the black sugar is added, but white sugar is also added in some cases.
Basically black sugar is added, but white sugar is also added in some cases.
Usually black sugar is added, but white sugar is also added in some cases.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 青柳総本家（創業明治12年・1879年）の青柳ういろうは、砂糖（しろ）・黒砂糖（くろ）・抹茶・小豆（上がり）・さくらの他様々なバリエーションを持つ。
sen.e: The Aoyagi Uiro of the main branch of Aoyagi family (founded in 1879) has a variety other than white sugar, black sugar, green powdered tea, an adzuki bean (called agari) and cherry blossom.
The Aoyagi Uiro of the main branch of Aoyagi family (founded in 1879) has a variety other than white sugar, black sugar, green powdered tea, and adzuki bean (called agari) and cherry blossom.
The Aoyagi Uiro of the Aoyagi family (founded in 1879) has variations including Uiro with white sugar, black sugar, green powdered tea, azuki bean (called agari) and cherry blossoms.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 130年以上の歴史があるういろうの老舗で、生産量、販売数も日本一である。
sen.e: It is a long-established store with more than 130 years history and its amount of production and sales are the largest in Japan.
It is a long-established store with more than a 130 year history and produces and sells the largest amount in Japan.
It is a long-established store with more than a 130 year history and is the largest producer and seller of Uiro in Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: またういろうの他にも青柳総本家の「カエルまんじゅう」や「きしめんパイ」も名古屋土産として人気がある。
sen.e: In addition, 'Frog manju (Frog face-like steamed bean-jam bun)' and 'Kishimen pie (Flat wheat noodle-like pie)' of the main branch of Aoyagi family are also popular as a souvenir of the Nagoya City other than Uiro.

In addition, 'Frog manju (Frog face-like steamed bean-jam bun)' and 'Kishimen pie (Flat wheat noodle-like pie)' of the main branch of Aoyagi family are also popular as a souvenir of Nagoya City other than Uiro.
In addition, 'Frog manju' (frog face-like steamed bean-jam bun) and 'Kishimen pie' (flat wheat noodle-like pie) of the main branch of Aoyagi family are also popular as a souvenirs of Nagoya City.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションの位置を変えました。

sen.j: 名古屋市中区 (名古屋市)大須に本社がある株式会社大須ういろ（創業昭和23年・1948年）で製造しているういろうは「ういろ」（登録商標）で、「ないろ」は小豆のういろである。
sen.e: The Uiro which is produced by Osu Uiro Inc. (founded in 1948), the head office of which locates in Osu, Naka Ward, Nagoya City, is 'Uiro (ういろ)' (registered brand) and 'Nairo' is a kind of Uiro using an adzuki bean.

The Uiro which is produced by Osu Uiro Inc. (founded in 1948), the head office of which locates in Osu, Naka Ward, Nagoya City, is 'Uiro (ういろ)' (registered brand) and 'Nairo' is a kind of Uiro using an adzuki bean.

The Uiro which is produced by Osu Uiro Inc. (founded in 1948), the head office of which is in Osu, Naka Ward, Nagoya City, is 'Uiro' (registered brand) and 'Nairo' is a kind of Uiro using an azuki bean.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。表記を変えました。

tit.e: The Uiro in the Ise area
The Uiro in the Ise area
The Uiro in the Ise area

sen.j: 伊勢地方では、伝統的に黒砂糖を用いたういろうが食されていた。
sen.e: In the Ise area, the Uiro of the black sugar had been eaten traditionally.
In the Ise area, the Uiro of black sugar was traditionally eaten.
In the Ise region, Uiro with black sugar was traditionally eaten.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 現在は、虎屋ういろ（伊勢市）がういろうの製造、販売を行っている。
sen.e: At present, Toraya Uiro (Ise City) produces and sells Uiro.
At present, Toraya Uiro (Ise City) produces and sells Uiro.
Toraya Uiro (Ise City) currently produces and sells Uiro.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 原材料に小麦粉を使用するため、米粉を用いた他地域のものと食感が微妙に異なることや、防腐剤を使用しない生ういろうであるため、消費期限が短いことなどが特徴としてあげられる。
sen.e: It is characterized by the slight difference in texture because it uses flour for ingredients instead of rice powder like in other areas and the shortness of expiration date because it does not include antiseptic materials.

It is characterized by the slight difference in texture because it uses flour as an ingredient instead of rice powder like in other areas and the short expiration date because it does not include antiseptic materials.

It is characterized by the slight difference in texture because it uses flour as an ingredient instead of rice powder like in other areas and has a short expiration date because it does not include preservatives.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 加える材料などで35種類程度のバリエーションがある。
sen.e: It has thirty-five types depending on ingredients.
There are over thirty-five variations depending on the ingredients.
There are over 35 variations by ingredients.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。アラビア数字にし補足しました。

tit.e: The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture
The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture
The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture

sen.j: 山口のういろうはワラビの粉に砂糖を加え、蒸して作られる。
sen.e: The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture is made by adding sugar to the powder of bracken and steaming it.
The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture is made by adding sugar to the powder of bracken and steaming it.
The Uiro in the Yamaguchi Prefecture is made by adding sugar to the powder of bracken and steaming it.

sen.j: 小豆、抹茶等が加えられることもある。
sen.e: The other ingredients such as an adzuki bean and green powdered tea are added in some cases.
The other ingredients such as an adzuki bean and green powdered tea are added in some cases.
Other ingredients include azuki beans and powdered tea.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 他の地方のういろうと異なり、わらびもちを彷彿とする、くせのない、とろりとした食感が特徴である。
sen.e: Different from the Uiro in other regions, it is characterized by the plain texture that melts in the mouth and reminds bracken-starch dumpling.
Different from the Uiro in other regions, it is characterized by a plain texture that melts in the mouth and reminds one of bracken-starch dumplings.
They are different from the Uiro in other regions, and are characterized by a plain texture that melts in the mouth and reminds one of warabi-starch dumplings.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 山口県下では山口市だけでなく、県下の多くの地域でういろうが作られており、他に岩国市（ふるたのういろう）などが、ういろうが名物である都市として知られる。
sen.e: In the Yamaguchi Prefecture, the Uiro is produced not only in the Yamaguchi City but also other many areas, among which the Iwakuni City is known for its famous product of Furuta no Uiro (Furuta's Uiro).

In the Yamaguchi Prefecture, the Uiro is produced not only in the Yamaguchi City but also in many other areas, among which the Iwakuni City is known for its famous product of Furuta no Uiro (Furuta's Uiro).
In Yamaguchi Prefecture, Uiro is produced not only in Yamaguchi City but also in many other areas, among which Iwakuni City is known for its famous product called Furuta no Uiro.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。補足しました。

sen.j: また周南市もかつてはういろうが名物であった（原要うい郎、2006年5月に廃業）。
sen.e: In addition, another Uiro in the Shunan City was its famous product at one time (Harayo Uiro, closing down its businesses on May 2006).
In addition, another Uiro in the Shunan City was its famous product at one time (Harayo Uiro, closing down its businesses on May 2006).
Shunan City also used to have a famous Uiro product Harayo Uiro although this closed down in May 2006.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: なお、現在では山口県内のどの新幹線駅売店でも手軽に購入できる。
sen.e: Furthermore, it can be bought easily in any stands on the station of Shinkansen bullet train in the Yamaguchi Prefecture.
Furthermore, it can be bought easily at any stand on the Shinkansen bullet train station in the Yamaguchi Prefecture.
Furthermore, it can be purchased at any stand on the Shinkansen bullet train stations in the Yamaguchi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 山口ういろうは、室町時代に周防国山口市の秋津治郎作が、現在の製法を考えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that the process of manufacture of Yamaguchi Uiro was invented by Jirosaku AKITSU (秋津治郎作) in the Yamaguchi City, the Suo Province in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 「秋津治郎作」の読み方不明です。
sen.e: It is said that the process of manufacture of Yamaguchi Uiro was invented by Jirosaku AKITSU (秋津治郎作) in the Yamaguchi City, the Suo Province in the Muromachi period.
It is said that the process of manufacture of Yamaguchi Uiro was invented by Jirosaku AKITSU in Yamaguchi City, Suo Province in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: その後、長州藩主より、福田屋の商号を授かり、現在の山口市大内御堀の萩往還沿いで商売を行った。
sen.e: After that, he was given the trade name of Fukudaya by the lord of Choshu domain and started a business along the present Hagi Okan (Hagi Highway) at Ouchimihori in the Yamaguchi City.
After that, he was given the trade name of Fukudaya by the lord of Choshu domain and started a business along the present Hagi Okan (Hagi Highway) at Ouchimihori in the Yamaguchi City.
After that, he was given the trade name of Fukudaya by the lord of Choshu domain and started a business along the present Hagi Okan (Hagi Highway) at Ouchimihori in Yamaguchi City.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: このういろうは中原中也もよく食べていたが、太平洋戦争で後継者をなくし、廃業してしまう。
sen.e: This Uiro was favored by Chuya NAKAHARA, but it closed down the businesses because of the loss of its successor in the Pacific War.
This Uiro was favored by Chuya NAKAHARA, but closed down due to the loss of their successor in the Pacific War.
This Uiro was favored by Chuya NAKAHARA, but closed down due to the death of their successor in the Pacific War.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、その福田屋の職人だった人物が御堀堂を、福田屋のういろうをよく食べていた人物が豆子郎を創業し、山口ういろうの味が現在まで受け継がれることとなった。
sen.e: However, since a workman of the Fukudaya founded Mihorido and a person who favored the Uiro of Fukudaya founded Toshiro, the taste of the Yamaguchi Uiro has been succeeded until now.
However, since a workman of the Fukudaya founded Mihorido and a person who favored the Uiro of Fukudaya founded Toshiro, the taste of the Yamaguchi Uiro has been succeeded until now.
However, since an employee of Fukudaya founded Mihorido and a person who favored the Uiro of Fukudaya founded Toshiro, the taste of the Yamaguchi Uiro has been passed on.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースをのぞきました。

tit.e: The Uiro in the Tokushima Prefecture
The Uiro in the Tokushima Prefecture
The Uiro in the Tokushima Prefecture

sen.j: 「阿波ういろ」と総称される。
sen.e: It is generically called 'Awa Uiro.'
It is generically called 'Awa Uiro.'
They are collectively called 'Awa Uiro.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 徳島県においては、和三盆を用いたものや、漉し餡を混ぜて、棒状に加工した「棒ういろ」、「一口ういろ」、クリを用いた「栗ういろ」などが作られている。
sen.e: In the Tokushima Prefecture, various Uiro such as the one using wasanbon (refined sugar made from sugarcane in Japan), 'Bo Uiro (Stick Uiro)' mixed with koshian (pureed bean jam) and processed into a stick shape, 'Hitokuchi Uiro (One Bite-sized Uiro)' and 'Kuri Uiro (Chestnut Uiro)' using chestnut.

In the Tokushima Prefecture, various Uiro such as those using wasanbon (refined sugar made from sugarcane in Japan), 'Bo Uiro (Stick Uiro)' mixed with koshian (pureed bean jam) and processed into a stick shape, 'Hitokuchi Uiro (One Bite-sized Uiro)' and 'Kuri Uiro (Chestnut Uiro)' using chestnut are made.

In Tokushima Prefecture, various Uiro such as those using refined sugar made from sugarcane in Japan, Stick Uiro mixed with koshian (pureed bean jam) and processed into a stick shape, 'Hitokuchi Uiro' (one bite-sized Uiro) and 'Kuri Uiro' (chestnut Uiro) using chestnut can be found.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペースを補足、クォーテーションの位置を変えるなどしました。

sen.j: 七五三などの行事の際に自宅で作ることもあったという。
sen.e: It is said that it was made at home in the special events such as Shichi-go-san (a day of prayer for the healthy growth of young children).
